channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Akira Ransomware Targets M&A Blind Spots, Breaching Firms via Inherited SonicWall Devices
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group is exploiting security blind spots created during corporate mergers and acquisitions (M&A). According to research by ReliaQuest, Akira affiliates are gaining initial access to acquiring companies by compromising vulnerable SonicWall SSL VPN appliances inherited from smalle...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive NPM Supply Chain Attack Spreads Self-Replicating "Shai-Hulud" Worm
item.description:
A significant, ongoing supply chain attack is targeting the NPM JavaScript ecosystem, where a self-replicating worm dubbed "Shai-Hulud" has infected over 400 software packages. The attack has a substantial impact on the cryptocurrency sector, compromising at least 10 widely used libraries crucial fo...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: FCC Rolls Back ISP Cybersecurity Rules Despite China-Linked Hacking Threats
item.description:
In a controversial decision, the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has rescinded cybersecurity regulations for internet service providers (ISPs). These rules were implemented by the Biden Administration following the discovery that the Chinese state-sponsored hacking group Salt Typhoon ha...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Gang Hits LG Energy Solution, Claims 1.7TB Data Theft
item.description:
South Korean battery manufacturing giant LG Energy Solution has confirmed it was the victim of a ransomware attack at one of its overseas facilities. The notorious Akira ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for the breach, alleging on its dark web leak site that it stole 1.7 terabytes of data ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: New "Autumn Dragon" Espionage Campaign Targets Southeast Asia
item.description:
A newly identified cyber-espionage campaign named "Autumn Dragon" has been targeting government and media organizations across Southeast Asia since early 2025. The operation, attributed with medium confidence to a China-nexus Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, aims to gather intelligence relate...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShadowPad Backdoor Deployed via Critical WSUS Server Vulnerability
item.description:
An active intrusion campaign is exploiting a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). Attackers, believed to be Chinese state-sponsored APTs, are leveraging the flaw to gain system-level access and deploy the sophistica...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Supply Chain Breaches Escalate Despite Maturing Defenses, Report Finds
item.description:
A new 2025 report from cybersecurity firm BlueVoyant reveals a troubling trend: despite most organizations maturing their third-party risk management (TPRM) programs, the number of supply chain breaches is escalating. The study found that 97% of surveyed organizations experienced a supplier-related ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Peak on Holidays and Weekends, Exploiting Low Staffing
item.description:
A new global study by Semperis, the "2025 Holiday Ransomware Risk Report," confirms that threat actors strategically launch attacks during holidays and weekends to exploit reduced security staffing. The report found that 52% of organizations were targeted during these off-hour periods. Alarmingly, 7...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Italian IT Firm Almaviva Hit by Cyberattack, 2.3TB of Data Leaked
item.description:
The prominent Italian IT services provider Almaviva has confirmed it was hit by a major cyberattack, resulting in the theft and leaking of nearly 2.3 terabytes of sensitive data. The breach has exposed information from several of Almaviva's clients, most notably Italy's national railway operator, Fe...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Harvard University Data Breach Exposes Donor Information After Phone Phishing Attack
item.description:
Harvard University has disclosed a data breach affecting its Alumni Affairs and Development Office, discovered on November 18, 2025. The incident originated from a phone-based phishing (vishing) attack that gave an unauthorized party access to systems containing personal information and donation rec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →
